Submodules

src.utils.preprocess_helper module

src.utils.preprocess_helper.compute_moving_average(arr: array, idx: int)[source]

Computes the average value of missing np.nan value at idx from the array.

Parameters:

  • arr – (np.array) object containing (np.nan) missing values.

  • idx – (int) index of the (np.nan) value.

Returns:

The mean of the first and last values between the given index.

src.utils.preprocess_helper.create_pivot_from_df(df: DataFrame, index: str, columns: str, values: str)[source]

Transforms (pandas.DataFrame) object into (pandas.DataFrame) pivot object. The data is aggregated based on the index and columns parameters.

Parameters:

  • df – (pandas.DataFrame) which will be used for the creation of the pivot.

  • index – text value which will be used as index parameter for the pivot.

  • columns – text value which will be used as columns parameter for the pivot.

  • values – text value which will be used as values parameter for the pivot.

Returns:

(pandas.DataFrame) pivot like object.

src.utils.preprocess_helper.fill_nan_values(pivot: DataFrame)[source]

Fills (np.nan) values from pivot (pd.DataFrame) object.

Parameters:

pivot – (pd.DataFrame) pivot object containing (np.nan) values.

Returns:

Returns (pd.DataFrame) pivot object without (np.nan) values.

src.utils.preprocess_helper.predict_future_yearly_data(pivot: DataFrame, future_years: list, type: str, index: str, value: str)[source]

Predicts future values for the given param future_years by using ARIMA (Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average) model.

Parameters:

  • pivot – (pd.DataFrame) preprocessed pivot object containing the values for each param type

  • future_years – (list) containing the future years for which a prediction will be made

  • type – variable used as a column name for extracting unique values and filtering values from the param pivot

  • index – usually called year this parameter will be used as a column name for getting the yearly based data from the param pivot

  • value – usually the column name from the pivot table used as a value, because the param pivot should be in a pivot like (pd.DataFrame) object format

Returns:

(pd.DataFrame) object containing the future data generated with the same format as the passed param pivot.

Module contents

src.utils.check_connection(engine, desc='')[source]

debounced: Checks the database connection every 30 seconds.

Parameters:

  • engine (sqlalchemy.engine.Engine) – The SQLAlchemy database engine.

  • desc (str, optional) – An optional description to include in the success message.

src.utils.clean_GeoDataFrame(gdf, epsg=4326, geo_col=None, district_col=None)[source]
src.utils.data_typing(df, integers=[], floats=[], strings=[], categoricals=[], dates={}, only_years=[], only_months=[], only_days=[])[source]

Performs data typing on a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas DataFrame to perform data typing on.

  • integers (list, optional) – A list of column names to be typed as integers.

  • floats (list, optional) – A list of column names to be typed as floats.

  • strings (list, optional) – A list of column names to be typed as strings.

  • categoricals (list, optional) – A list of column names to be typed as categoricals.

  • dates (dict, optional) – A dictionary mapping date column names to their format strings (e.g., {‘date_column’: ‘%Y-%m-%d’}).

  • only_years (list, optional) – A list of date column names to extract only the year.

  • only_months (list, optional) – A list of date column names to extract only the month.

  • only_days (list, optional) – A list of date column names to extract only the day.

Returns:

The modified DataFrame with the specified column types applied.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
